item.title: Christina (Reading Thru The Night) add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Isn't it nice to think that tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet?" -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Christina (Reading Thru The Night) add a quote by Jane Yolen
item.description: "Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood." -- Jane Yolen

item.title: Christina (Reading Thru The Night) add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Christina (Reading Thru The Night) add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Christina (Reading Thru The Night) add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Christina (Reading Thru The Night) add a quote by Catherynne M. Valente
item.description: "One ought not to judge her: all children are Heartless. They have not grown a heart yet, which is why they can climb high trees and say shocking things and leap so very high grown-up hearts flutter in terror. Hearts weigh quite a lot. That is why it takes so long to grow one. But, as in their reading and arithmetic and drawing, different children proceed at different speeds. (It is well known that reading quickens the growth of a heart like nothing else.) Some small ones are terrible and fey, Utterly Heartless. Some are dear and sweet and Hardly Heartless At All. September stood very generally in the middle on the day the Green Wind took her, Somewhat Heartless, and Somewhat Grown." -- Catherynne M. Valente

item.title: Christina (Reading Thru The Night) add a quote by Catherynne M. Valente
item.description: "Stories have a way of changing faces. They are unruly things, undisciplined, given to delinquency and the throwing of erasers. This is why we must close them up into thick, solid books, so they cannot get out and cause trouble." -- Catherynne M. Valente

item.title: Christina (Reading Thru The Night) add a quote by Catherynne M. Valente
item.description: "We all live inside the terrible engine of authority, and it grinds and shrieks and burns so that no one will say: lines on maps are silly." -- Catherynne M. Valente

item.title: Christina (Reading Thru The Night) add a quote by Catherynne M. Valente
item.description: "Readers will always insist on adventures, and though you can have grief without adventures, you cannot have adventures without grief." -- Catherynne M. Valente

item.title: Christina (Reading Thru The Night) add a quote by Catherynne M. Valente
item.description: "That’s what happens to friends, eventually. They leave you. It’s practically what they’re for." -- Catherynne M. Valente

item.title: Christina (Reading Thru The Night) add a quote by John Green
item.description: "As he read, I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once." -- John Green

item.title: Christina (Reading Thru The Night) add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book." -- John Green

item.title: Christina (Reading Thru The Night) add a quote by John Green
item.description: "What a slut time is. She screws everybody." -- John Green

item.title: Christina (Reading Thru The Night) add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Some infinities are bigger than other infinities." -- John Green

item.title: Christina (Reading Thru The Night) add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Maybe there aren't any such things as good friends or bad friends - maybe there are just friends, people who stand by you when you're hurt and who help you feel not so lonely. Maybe they're always worth being scared for, and hoping for, and living for. Maybe worth dying for too, if that's what has to be. No good friends. No bad friends. Only people you want, need to be with; people who build their houses in your heart." -- Stephen King

item.title: Christina (Reading Thru The Night) add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Mrs. Cole was a perfect democrat. She hated all kids equally." -- Stephen King
